comments:
I20040226

1) Start a new workspace at a location containing spaces (e.g., "c:\Program
Files\eclipse\workspace").
2) Create a runtime workbench launch configuration and try to launch it.

-> The launch fails:

java.lang.RuntimeException: The FrameworkAdaptor object could not perform the
operation
	at
org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.Framework.initialize(Framework.java:124)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.Framework.<init>(Framework.java:96)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.OSGi.createFramework(OSGi.java:90)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.OSGi.<init>(OSGi.java:31)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:82)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at
sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:324)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:279)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:742)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:581)

I got the same stack trace trying to run a JUnit Plugin test launching
configuration that ran fine using M7 build. Now I am using the 0304 build and it
simply doesn't work anymore.
Do you have a workaround?
I increase the severity as this makes the build difficult to use.

It looks like the command line argument for the "-configuration" arg is being
messed up.  It specifies the location with a trailing slash, surrounded by
quotes.  Here is the command line as displayed by the debug view:

 d:\vm\sidecar\jre\bin\javaw.exe -classpath d:\eclipse\startup.jar -Xdebug
-Xnoagent -Djava.compiler=NONE
-Xrunjdwp:transport=dt_socket,suspend=y,address=localhost:1686
org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main -data "d:\1target\test 3\runtime-workspace"
-configuration "file:d:\1target\test
3\plugins\.metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.pde.core\d__1target_test
3_runtime-workspace\" -dev bin -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86 -nl en_US
-showsplash "d:\eclipse\eclipse -showsplash 600"

Notice the -configuration ends in runtime-workspace\"

The backslash causes the quote character to be escaped. By the time the
arguments arive inside Main.javaa, the value of -configuration is:

file:d:\1target\test
3\plugins\.metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.pde.core\d__1target_test
3_runtime-workspace" -dev bin -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86 -nl en_US
-showsplash d:\eclipse\eclipse

I.e., it includes the escaped quote character, and continues right up until the
next quote in the command line

Note I am using Sun 1.4.1 VM - may be VM dependent?

Dorian,
the backslashes were added based upon your request.
Can we revert back to forward slashes?
It is VM dependent since I'm using 1.4.2 and I do not see this problem

The correct file: url is with forward slashes
file:d:/path/to/some/directory/
*** Bug 54520 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
